definition: mechanical components that spin, rotate, or enable rotational motion in machines

positive_examples: The motor's rotor spins at 3600 RPM when powered on
The crankshaft transfers power from the pistons to the transmission
A heavy flywheel helps smooth out engine vibrations
The generator's stator windings produce electricity as the rotor turns
The drive shaft connects the engine to the rear wheels
The turbine rotor blades capture wind energy efficiently
negative_examples: The piston moves up and down in the cylinder
The hydraulic pump creates pressure in the system
The belt connects two pulleys together
The gear teeth mesh to change rotational speed
The lever amplifies the applied force
The spring stores mechanical energy when compressed
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Gears, Pistons, Levers, Pumps
